data.title: Ron Howard's Net Worth and Inspiring Story
data.meta_description: Curious about Ron Howard's net worth? This guide tells all about the actor, director, and producer's career, personal life, and wealth.
data.text:
From television actor to world-famous producer, Ron Howard is known for his directorial career making critically acclaimed films. His film productions and successes have accrued a fortune and established him as one of Hollywood’s most prolific directors. The article below covers Ron Howard's net worth, his origins as a sitcom star, progression in movie production, and how he achieved his accomplishments.

Plus, find out how we can help you build a million dollar brand in about a year... FREE.

What is Ron Howard's net worth?

Ron Howard’s career and ventures have earned him an estimated net worth of $200 million.

Who is Ron Howard?

Ronald William Howard is an American film screenwriter, producer, and actor. He is the son of Rance Howard and Jean Speegle, born on March 1, 1954. Ron first appeared on stage, at the age of 18 months, in the romantic comedy The Seven Year Itch. He debuted his acting career in 1959 and appeared in several series such as The Dupont Show with June Allyson, Twilight Zone, Dennis the Menace, and The Cheyenne Show. His most iconic child role was in The Andy Griffith Show, where the actor starred as Opie Taylor for eight seasons. His movie appearances continued until 1980 after he began his directorial profession.

By age 23, Ron had already directed several episodes of the Happy Days television series, in which he starred. He was often considered too young and inexperienced in film directing, and most producers were unwilling to work with him. However, he persisted in his passion, got his first chance with filmmaker Roger Corman, and produced the low-budget yet commercially successful film Grand Theft Auto.

Ron Howard's first mainstream production was the comedy film Night Shift in 1982, followed by his box-office hit movie, Splash in 1984. He ventured into diverse film genres, such as fantasy, historical biopics, dramas, mysteries, docudramas, science fiction, and animations. Ron co-founded the production company Imagine Entertainment in 1985, which released the widely received television shows 24 in 2001 and Arrested Development in 2003.

He married Cheryll Alley in 1975, and they have four children: Bryce Dallas, Jocelyn Carlyle, Page Carlyle, and Reed Cross Howard.

What are the sources of Ron Howard's wealth?

Ron Howard has a broad portfolio of film acting and productions. As such, the following has contributed to his wealth and celebrity status.

Acting

Ron Howard has been acting since childhood, and his roles have garnered recognition in the television and film industry.

Producing

As a producer, Ron has released cinematic masterpieces that have remained all-time classics and acquired massive box office returns.

Directing

Ron has directed films and captured the stories best-sellers have depicted. He also offers classes on the trade.

Writing

Based on his experience with different genres of films, Ron has expressed his creativity in screenwriting as an addition to film production.

Investment in Companies

He co-founded the Ron and Cheryl Howard Family Foundation, which invests in microfinancing developing economies and artistic endeavors.

Endorsements

Ron endorses various charities, including

The child empowerment charity Boys & Girls Clubs of America

Bring Change 2 Mind mental health advocacy

Communities in Schools educational support organization

The child and education provision establishment Donors Choose

Oceana environmental protection campaign

Filmography

As a former child star and movie production mogul, Ron has an extensive film career comprising 87 acting roles and over 300 cameos in reality shows and documentaries.

Television Shows

The celebrity has appeared, cameoed, and produced television series that significantly boosted his income.

Personal Properties

The renowned producer owns several estate properties in New York, Connecticut, and Santa Monica worth over $27 million.

Partnerships

The movie director partners with fellow producer Brain Grazer and co-owns the Imagine Entertainment franchise. He also partnered with Master Class to provide teaching sessions on directing.
